Posts.Content: On 5/24/2004 Loveforsister wrote: Three years after a double masectomy, having her lymph nodes under her arms removed and having treatment, my sister has swollen lymph nodes in the right side front and back of her neck. Besides that she is feeling fine. Does anyone have any further information on what this could be? Thank you.
Posts.Title: Swollen Lymph Nodes in Back of Head

Posts.Content: I was diagnosed with LCIS last year and now the doctor found a lump in the same area again. I had a mammo and an ultrasound, but the scar tissue was in the way, so they want me to get a MRI.  Has this happened to anyone.  should I get the MRI? Jennifer
Posts.Title: LCIS

Posts.Content: On 2/8/2008 Jennia wrote:   On 5/24/2004 Loveforsister wrote: Three years after a double masectomy, having her lymph nodes under her arms removed and having treatment, my sister has swollen lymph nodes in the right side front and back of her neck. Besides that she is feeling fine. Does anyone have any further information on what this could be? Thank you. What was the outcome of the lump on the back of your neck.  I was diagnosed with Lobular Carcinoma last year and now a year later I have a lump on the back right of my neck.  Yesterday I went to do my yearly and my doctor found something on my breast so I am having a mammo today.  I was just wondering if the two symptons were related. Thanks and look forward to hearing from you. Jennifer
Posts.Title: Swollen Lymph Nodes in Back of Head
